com.minecolonies.coremod.enchanter.nodra: Please configure some workers I can drain experience from so I can work!
I haven't had a house for over 2 weeks! I'm getting really upset!
I've been unable to work for more than two weeks already! Do something!
I've been waiting for over two weeks to get a job! I'm getting very upset!
I'm still processing %ss death, I can't work today.
I'd really like a house to live in.
I'm idle at my job because of missing items, please take care of that!
I didn't have enough time to go to sleep in the last three days!
Having a job would really be great.
Help! The colony is being raided. I am running for shelter.
I don't like staying out in the rain, my clothes are gonna get wet.
All colonists are tucked into bed.
zZzz... I want to sleep... Why are you bothering me?

com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.barracks.sp: During raids, you can hire spies here to infiltrate the enemy lines. The spies then let you know enemy positions, although they demand some gold as payment. Put the gold into the Barracks inventory to automatically pay them.

com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.drcat: Miau, mew, mau, meee, mew, hiss, nyan, mew!!! brrrrrrrrrbrrrrrrbrrrrr
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.hometo: I have to walk a long way home from work every day. It would be nice if I could live somewhere closer.
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.hyrios: I am Asuna, I have come here from Aincrad to defend your freedom!
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.ignore: That has to do for now!
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.noguar: There are no Guard or Barrack Towers near my home, so I don't feel safe there!
There are no Guard or Barrack Towers near my workplace, so I don't feel safe there!
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.nospac: Your colony does not have enough space to house another citizen.
%s would be willing to join your colony for %s, but it seems you lack living space in your colony.
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.noteno: You do not have the fitting items in your inventory to offer this visitor!
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.chat.recrui: Recruit for
%s would be willing to join your colony for %s.
comes from a cold place up north. Hoping to find a warmer place, %s stopped by your tavern.
has excellent masonry skills, but %s's father wanted a cowhand instead.
is a noble from a distant town. %s thinks they will surely become the governor of this tiny colony soon.
waves their hand and mumbles something like mae tree force bee wich you.
has seen many towns, but none as beautiful as this.
comes from a neighboring town where %s worked as a Carpenter.
is from a place where the old, dusty books live. But after living so long in between these books, %s needed to see other people.
always wanted to build houses. Big houses, tiny houses, building with wingardium leviosa - but that doesn't seem to work at as the traveling sorcerer said, so %s is now resting at your Tavern.
is an avid guard and while fighting against hordes of zombies, skeletons, and those weird endermen, %s heard about a colony which could use a little help against raiders.
is a treasure hunter. But digging in someone else's trash in search for some gold or iron is very tiring. Now %s looks for another task.
seems adept at using swords and says 'If by my life or death I can protect you, I will. You have my sword.'
is not a fan of this place, but didnt see any others close by.
is never late, nor early. %s arrives precisely when they mean to.
likes to wander around the world. Wandering makes them hungry and thirsty, so %s stopped by your tavern.
is not the biggest one, but firmly believes that even the smallest person can change the course of the future.
saw a village with its inhabitants going around in minecarts. It seemed like fun, and maybe %s can do that here!
travels around a lot. A stranger once said 'Chewie, we're home.' %s couldn't make much sense of it, though!
is rather weird. Anytime you pass by, %s utters 'Live long and prosper.'
was a rich traveling trader until someone robbed %s of all their goods.
was known as a strong fighter in a faraway kingdom, though for some reason %s cannot go back there.
I was peacefully living my daily life as a farmer, then I got bitten by a zombie. Thanks for saving me!

com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.townhall.ha: Injuries
Deaths
Decreases happiness if colonists has been injured recently.
Decreases happiness if colonists has died recently.
Decreases happiness if colonists are sick.
Increases happiness if colonists have housing, and for higher-level housing.
Decreases happiness if colonists are unable to work due to missing tools or farmer fields.
Increases happiness if the colony has a Mystical Site, based on that Site's level.
Increases happiness if the colony has survived a raid without a civilian death recently.
Increases happiness as colonists are well-fed.
Increases happiness for child colonists if they are assigned to a school.
Increases happiness as more guards are employed at the colony.
Increases happiness if civilian colonists have been able to sleep recently.
Decreases happiness if fellow colonists are unhappy due to sickness, unemployment, homelessness, or starvation.
Increases happiness if colonists have a job, and for higher-level work buildings.

com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.townhall.me: You've encountered some Mercenaries near your colony, and they offer to help with defending your colony. A price they did not name, but you get the feeling that they will not leave bare-handed. Hire at your own risk!
com.minecolonies.coremod.gui.townhall.pl: You are not permitted to add new players. Ask a colony manager to turn on "Edit permissions" for your rank.

You must construct this hut before you can hire a worker!

com.minecolonies.coremod.healer.fullinv: My inventory is full, I can't receive the cure!
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.0: The Baker is part of the food production of your colony. They will bake bread, cookies, pumpkin pie, and/or cake. On page two of the Bakery GUI, you can select which items you want them to make.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.1: The Baker cannot make any food with items that are not consumed in the making like pots and pans. These are usually from mods like Pam's.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Baker is using more items than they are producing, why?
   A 1. The Baker may be consuming some product when they get hungry. Also, while the wheat/other ingredients may not be visible, the product may still be in the process of being produced.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.baker.3:
As all workers do, the Baker levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Baker's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.0:
The Barracks is the heart of your military defense. Without it you wouldn't be able to build any Barracks Towers!
 Each Barracks contains four Barracks Towers, one for each level (up to level four).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Barracks only hold 1 Barracks Tower per level, and each tower can only level as high as the Barracks. So if you have a level 1 Barracks, it will only allow 1 Barracks Tower with a max level of 1. If you have a level 3 Barracks, it will allow 3 Barracks Towers with a max level of 3.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracks.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I have more than 1 Barracks?
   A 1. Yes, but the Barracks Tower levels are based on the Barracks they are attached to. So even if you have one Barracks that is level 5, if the second Barracks is only level 1, then that Barracks can only have a single level 1 tower.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.barracksto:
The Barracks Tower is the heart of your military defense. Each Barracks Tower employs 1 Guard per level for a total of 5. However, the Guards will also live in the tower, freeing up beds for more citizens.
There are two different types of Guards, Knights and Archers. Knights use swords, while Archers use bows.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Guards unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Barracks Tower was leveled up, but the Guards aren't asking for higher level equipment. Why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers do, the Guards level up while working.
 At higher levels, a Guard's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.0:
The Builder is the heart of your colony. Without them, you wouldn't be able to get anything done!
 Every hut worker has to have their building built to at least level 1 before they can do anything, except the Builder. If the Builder has a hut at level 0 (no hut), they can only build one thing, their own hut.

 For your Builder to build, upgrade, reposition, or repair a hut that isn't their own, their hut must be at least the same level as the other hut. For example, the Builder's Hut must be level 3 or above to build a level 3 hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.1:
Let's cover builder restrictions:

 1. Builders (and most other workers) unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Builders have a maximum range of 100 blocks for buildings for automatic assignment. If your building is outside that range, in the top right of the build options GUI (for the hut you want to be built) you can select which Builder to assign to that building.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I'm seeing an item in the required resources page that seems unobtainable or requires Silk Touch to get. What should I do?
   A 1. Things like Air, Dirt Paths, and other blocks will show up in the required resources tab from time to time. While they do show up, focus mainly on your Builder's personal request tab. They'll usually request the correct block and convert it accordingly (e.g. request dirt and then use a shovel on it).
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.builder.3:
As all workers do, the Builder levels up while working.
 At higher levels, the Builder's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.chickenher: The Chicken Farmer is part of the food production of your colony. The Chicken Farmer breeds, raises, and butchers chickens. They will collect eggs, feathers, and meat, as well as any drops from other mods. The Chicken Farmer will keep two chickens alive per level of their hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Chicken Farmers unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two chickens must be provided for the Chicken Farmer to start breeding and butchering.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Chicken Farmer need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two chickens to get things started. The Chicken Farmer also needs seeds to breed the chickens and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers do, the Chicken Farmer levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Chicken Farmer's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.0: The House is where your citizens will live. For every level of the House, the building will house one citizen. You will need multiple houses to house everyone. The only citizens that will not live in a House are your Guards.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.1: In order to have children, a male and a female citizen must be housed together in one House. Even if you don't have room in the same hut as them, as long as there is an open bed in any House or Tavern within the colony, a child can be born. If there is an adult in another house, the child will be adopted by them, taking on the last name of that adult. If there is a hut with no adult in it, the child will get a random name.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.citizen.2: Workers have their level capped by the level of their House. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Composter is part of the crafting line of your colony. The Composter will turn items into compost for Farmers and Florists to use.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. You must choose which items you want the Composter to use to make compost with. This is found on page two of the hut GUI. 
   Be careful using food items if you have a large colony but not many food production huts!

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. Can I use items from other mods?
   A 1. Yes, but these must be added in the MineColonies configuration file. This is found in (your instance folder)/config/minecolonies-common.toml.

As all workers do, the Composter levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Composter's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.0:
The Cook is part of the food production of your colony. The Cook supplies all your citizens with food and will cook meat and potatoes, as well as other cooked food that only needs a furnace.
 When a citizen gets hungry, they will go to the Cook to get something to eat.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.1:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. The Cook is asking for items that are already cooked, is this normal?
   A 1. You can provide pre-cooked items for the Cook to distribute to your colonists.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cook.2:
As all workers do, the Cook levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Cook's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.0: The Cowhand is part of the food production of your colony. The Cowhand breeds, raises, and butchers cows. They will collect the meat and leather, as well as any drops from other mods. The Cowhand will keep two cows alive per level of their hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Cowhands unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two cows must be provided for the Cowhand to start breeding and butchering.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Cowhand need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two cows to get things started. The Cowhand also needs wheat to breed the cows and an axe to butcher them.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.cowboy.3:
As all workers do, the Cowhand levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Cowhand's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.deliveryma: Couriers are part of colony management. They are the transportation service of the colony and will pick up unneeded items from worker huts and drop them at the Warehouse, as well as gather needed items from the Warehouse and deliver them to workers.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 The number of stacks a Courier can carry at a time depends on their hut level. 
 Level 1: 1 Stack 
 Level 2: 2 Stacks 
 Level 3: 4 Stacks 
 Level 4: 8 Stacks 
 Level 5: unlimited stacks (that can still fit in their inventory)

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How do I change the priority of who the Couriers pick up from?
   A 1. In each hut, there is a pickup priority setting. 1 is the lowest, 10 is the highest, and there's also never (no items will ever be picked up).

 Q 2. Can I change the delivery priority?
 A 2. No, the delivery schedule is determined by the order the request is sent.

As all workers do, Couriers level up while working.
 At higher levels, a Courier's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.0: The Farmer is part of the food production of your colony. The Farmer grows crops for the colony. The Farmer can plant and harvest any crop that is planted in farmland, even from other mods.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.1:
Farmers unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Farmers cannot grow plants that do not use farmland, such as sugar cane, cactus, or bamboo. These are grown by the Planter instead.
 Farmers can only maintain one field per each hut level.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. I want a smaller field, how do I tell my Farmer not to grow crops up to the maximum size? 
   A 1. Use the Field GUI to set the size of the field.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.farmer.3:
As all workers do, the Farmer levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Farmer's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Fisher is part of the food production of your colony. Simply put, the Fisher will fish as long as you provide them with a fishing rod and a big enough area of water.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. The Fisher needs a body of water at least seven blocks by seven blocks and at least one block deep. The hut block must be at the same level as the water and must be <= ten blocks from the water.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Fisher is catching more than just fish, why?
   A 1. The Fishermen can catch other items, same as a player can.

As all workers do, the Fisher levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Fisher's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Graveyard is the resting place of your fallen citizens!

Without it, you'll still be able to manually collect fallen citizens' graves, but your colony will mourn longer.

Each Graveyard needs an Undertaker, who collects graves within the city.

During their free time, the Undertaker will get to know citizens and visit the Mystical Site, slowly attuning to the mana of the world.

If their Mana skill is high, the Undertaker has a small chance to resurrect a fallen citizen!

You can increase this chance by upgrading the Graveyard, building a Mystical Site, and completing researches in the University.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.guardtower:
The Guard Tower is the basic hut for your military defense. Each Guard Tower employs one Guard. However, the Guard will also live in the tower, freeing up a bed for more citizens.
There are two different types of Guards, Knights and Archers. Knights use swords, while Archers use bows.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Guards unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. My Guard Tower was leveled up, but the Guard isn't asking for higher-level equipment. Why?
   A 1. Guards will not ask for updated equipment until they use up their current equipment.

As all workers do, the Guard levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Guard's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.lumberjack:
The Forester is one of the production workers for your colony. Give them an axe and they'll cut down any trees around them. They'll also replant a sapling where the tree was if he has any.
 If you wish to apply restrictions on what trees they can or can't cut, take a look at the second page.
 Even cooler is the third page. Here you can tell the Forester to not replant saplings and tell them to be restricted to a certain area (selected with the tool given by the third button on the page).

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Foresters unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. Foresters are able to search for trees within 150 blocks of them (not their hut). While searching, they start with a 50 block range and then increase that range by 5 if they do not find a tree.

3. The definition of a "Tree" in Minecraft is pretty hazy at best. We've done our best to define a tree, but in some cases it may not be enough. Generally, we define a tree as a log and leaves next to each other. Due to this, some of your huts or decorations may be affected by the Forester. To counter this, you can place a piece of cobblestone below a log to mark it as "not a tree".

As all workers do, Foresters level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Forester's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.0: The Miner is one of the production workers for your colony. They will need a pickaxe to mine stone, a shovel to mine dirt and gravel, and sometimes even an axe if they run into a mineshaft. They will also need supplies to build their own mineshafts, such as blocks, slabs, fences/walls, signs, ladders, and torches.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.1:
Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Miners unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. How far down will my miner dig before making nodes?
   A 1. Without intervention, at level 1 they will build nodes after they hit y level 50, at level 2 they will make nodes after they hit y level 30, and at level 3 they will make nodes after they hit y level 5.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.3:
Q2. My Miner just stops working or wanders around above ground, why?
  A 2. Either something is blocking their path or they don't have the necessary materials. See page 1 for the materials they need or check the Miner's request page.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.miner.4:
As all workers do, Miners level up while working.
 At higher levels, the Miner's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.0: The Shepherd is part of the food production of your colony. The Shepherd breeds, raises, shears, and butchers sheep. They will collect the meat and wool, as well as any drops from other mods. The Shepherd will keep two sheep alive per level of their hut. If you choose, on the second page of the GUI you can tell the Shepherd to randomly dye sheep to get colored wool.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.1:
Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Shepherds unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two sheep must be provided for the Shepherd to start breeding and butchering.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.2:
Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Shepherd need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two sheep to get things started. The Shepherd also needs wheat to breed the sheep, shears to shear the wool, and an axe to butcher the sheep.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.shepherd.3:
As all workers do, the Shepherd levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Shepherd's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
com.minecolonies.coremod.info.swineherde: The Swineherd is part of the food production of your colony. The Swineherd breeds, raises, and butchers pigs. They will collect the meat, as well as any drops from other mods. The Swineherd will keep two pigs alive per level of their hut.

Now let's cover restrictions:

 1. Swineherds unlock certain tool levels per their hut level:
   lvl 0. Wood/Gold Tools
   lvl 1. Stone Tools
   lvl 2. Iron Tools
   lvl 4. Diamond Tools
   lvl 5. Enchanted Tools

 2. At least two pigs must be provided for the Swineherd to start breeding and butchering.

Now let's cover some frequently asked questions:

 Q 1. What does my Swineherd need to work?
   A 1. You need to supply at least two pigs to get things started. The Swineherd also needs carrots to breed the pigs and an axe to butcher them.

As all workers do, the Swineherd levels up while working.
 At higher levels, a Swineherd's speed increases. The higher their hut level and Intelligence skill, the quicker they level up. 
 However, their level is capped by the level of their home. Thus, if they are unhappy with their living conditions, they will stop leveling until you provide them with better housing.
The Warehouse is part of colony management. It's where all of your excess supplies are stored. There are no workers assigned to the Warehouse, but Couriers use the Warehouse.

Let's cover restrictions:

 1. Space is limited to the number of racks in the schematic and you can not add your own. If you do, they will get destroyed when the building is updated and the Couriers will not see/use those racks. You also cannot move the racks already in the building. If you break a rack, it is no longer seen by the Couriers.

3. Now let's cover some frequently asked questions: 

 Q 1. I need more storage space that is given, how do I get more? 
 A 1. Upgrade the building. If the building is level 5, you can increase the space in each rack by buying more on page 2 of the GUI using an emerald block. This can be done 3 times.

Q 2. I want to move my Warehouse, can I do that? 
 A 2. You can, but if there is anything in the racks, the contents will spill out when the racks are removed by the Builder. If you must move the Warehouse, remove all the contents from the racks first, and watch to make sure any Couriers don't deliver items.
com.minecolonies.coremod.invalidbuilding: The Building %s at position %d %d %d is missing its original blueprint of style %s. Building potentially inoperable. Please recover the blueprint or pickup and replace the building.
com.minecolonies.coremod.item.bannerrall: Error modifying banner. Please try again.
Sneak + right-click to rally or dismiss your Guards.
Sneak + Right-click on Guard Towers to add them to the rallying list.
com.minecolonies.coremod.item.buildlevel: Crafted by a %s level %s or higher
No colony set (sneak + use the clipboard on the Town Hall)
Noting requests on the clipboard from %s.
com.minecolonies.coremod.item.gate.place: Autoplaces parts. The max size is 5x4 which needs a stack of 20.
com.minecolonies.coremod.item.permission: You do not have permission to edit blocks with this tool!
com.minecolonies.coremod.item.scroll.nee: No Builder set (sneak + use the scroll on the Builder's Hut)
com.minecolonies.coremod.item.scroll.reg: Linked resources for Builder's Hut at %s.
com.minecolonies.coremod.item.sugary.bre: Boosts speed and removes poison effect
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.baker: Bakes bread, and other things at higher levels. Can be taught extra recipes starting at level 3.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.blacksmith: Crafts tools, weapons, armour, and many other things made of metal.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.composter: Uses compost barrels to turn various items into compost or dirt (look up usages for the compost barrel to see more). At higher skill levels, they can work faster than you can.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.concretemix: Crafts concrete powder and concrete. Can't learn other recipes.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.cook: The restaurant's cook will cook various food items until they are edible.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.cookassista: At level 3, the restaurant can hire an assistant to craft additional food recipes.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.crusher: Crushes blocks into base forms. Each building can only do one of these at a time.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.dyer: Crafts dyes and anything that uses dye as a component.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.farmer: In addition to tending fields, the farmer can craft things with hay, seeds, or dirt.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.fletcher: Crafts arrows and leather armor. Also plain items made from wool and string.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.glassblower: Smelts glass itself, plus crafts things made from glass as well.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.intermediat: This recipe requires access to a %s.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.levelrestri: This recipe is only available between building levels %d and %d.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.lumberjack: While they mostly just chop trees, they will also strip and modify logs if required.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.maxresearch: This recipe is only available until the research '%s' has been unlocked (then usually replaced with a better recipe).
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.mechanic: Crafts mechanisms or other things based on redstone, glowstone, pearls, blaze, etc.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.minresearch: This recipe is only available after the research '%s' has been unlocked.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.onelevelres: This recipe is only available at building level %d.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.planter: Grows cane and bamboo, and crafts things made with them too.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.sawmill: Crafts most things that are made primarily from wood.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.sifter: Extracts more valuable resources from common ones, but rarely. The mesh lasts a while, but can eventually break.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.smelter: Smelts ore (double or triple at higher levels).
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.stonemason: Crafts things made from various kinds of stone.
com.minecolonies.coremod.jei.stonesmelte: Smelts various kinds of stone and terracotta.
com.minecolonies.coremod.job.deliveryman: I can't deliver because %s has a full chest.
Please upgrade or build a Warehouse for me to work at.
I can't deliver because of a full worker chest.
com.minecolonies.coremod.job.guard.assig: Please assign this Guard to a Mine in the Mine GUI.
com.minecolonies.coremod.job.guard.switc: Switched to guarding since the player is out of sight.
Right-click on a block to set it as a guarding spot.
Right-click on a block to add it as a patrol target. Double-click to close the tool.
com.minecolonies.coremod.job.guard.toolc: Added position %s as a new guarding target for Guard %s.
Too far away from Guard Tower, please upgrade your Guard Tower to set this spot!
Added position %s as a new patrolling target for Guard %s.
com.minecolonies.coremod.locating: Successfully located rack with respective item(s).
com.minecolonies.coremod.mercenary.merce: %s is unhappy, a Mercenary took their %s!
com.minecolonies.coremod.mercenary.steal: A Mercenary just stole %s from a building!
com.minecolonies.coremod.mourning: There has been a death in %s. The citizens will mourn %s tomorrow out of respect.
com.minecolonies.coremod.movebuilding.in: Can't reposition to this position, undestroyable block at destination!
com.minecolonies.coremod.nospaceforgrave: Your Graveyard is full and %s couldn't be buried. Upgrade it or build more Graveyards before this happens again!
com.minecolonies.coremod.permission.no: You do not have permission to do this in this colony!
com.minecolonies.coremod.pirates.killed: Victory! %s rid the seas of the intruders!
com.minecolonies.coremod.pirates.sailing: A pirate ship %s of %s just sailed away to search for another victim.
com.minecolonies.coremod.pirates.spawner: %s successfully destroyed all the pirate spawners!
com.minecolonies.coremod.playerinvfull: You can't pick up this item, as your inventory is full!
com.minecolonies.coremod.playerinvfull.h: was dropped in front of you, as your inventory is full!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.all_ci: I see all your settlers have a nice home now. Build more Houses to get more settlers!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.builde: With the Builder's Hut completed, we should turn our attention to resource production. Perhaps you should get a Forester or Miner and a Tavern to house your citizens.

Great job on the placement of the Builder's Hut! However, that's not enough. You need to access it and click the Build Building button! Soon your citizen will be creating new structures for the colony.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.built_: While your Builder is working, you can check on the resources he needs on the second page of the building GUI.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.childg: %s grew up and wants a job now.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.citize: Your colony's population has grown to the limits of current management techniques. To accept more citizens, complete the research at the University.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.colony: Word is out about a newly founded colony. Soon the first settlers will join your colony, if there is enough space around the Town Hall. (Experienced governors can turn off these helpful messages in the Town Hall block.)
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.eight_: Your citizens urge you to build a Warehouse. This will lighten your backpack, and they may get their materials faster!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.first_: The first settler arrived at your colony! You should place a Builder's Hut to start your settlement.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.food_p: Your town starts to flourish! To improve the productivity, you might want to upgrade the buildings.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.four_c: All your initial settlers are now employed. To attract more settlers, you have to build or upgrade housing for them.
The last initial citizen arrived at your colony. To spawn new children, build a House and assign a male and female citizen to it.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.hireci: Your recruitment package was accepted and a new citizen arrived!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.manual: Workers are complaining about a long walk to their work. You can manually assign them to the closest houses if the option is turned on in the Town Hall settings.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.newchi: A new child, %s, is now happily living in %s!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.nine_c: Settlers are saying that their skills influence their leveling speed. You can manually employ citizens if it is turned on in the Town Hall settings. The best skills for the job will be highlighted during the employment process.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.not_en: Building more Houses than available jobs has a bad influence on your citizens' happiness.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.resour: Producing resources costs energy and makes your settlers hungry. You might want to build a Farm, Fisher's Hut, or animal herder's hut.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.seven_: A new settler arrived at your colony, and they bring word that barbarian spies have found the growing village. You might want to build a Guard Tower!
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.six_ci: A growing settlement means a growing responsibility. You should consider placing a Restaurant to keep your settlers well-fed.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.suppli: Welcome to MineColonies. Now that you have your supplies, how about searching a nice location to place your Town Hall to create your colony?
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.ten_ci: A growing colony increases the burdens on your settlers. You should consider upgrading your work huts.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.twenty: A barbarian spy had been caught next to your colony, and he seems to be from a bigger group! You should consider building Barracks to defend your colony.
com.minecolonies.coremod.progress.wareho: You've built a Warehouse. However, your people are too tasked as it is to fill it. Build some Courier's Huts to hire Couriers. Up to 2 can work per Warehouse level.
com.minecolonies.coremod.pvp.townhall.br: Beware! %s started breaking your Town Hall!
Beware!!! %s broke your Town Hall by over %d%%! At 100%% it will be lost!!!
com.minecolonies.coremod.recipe.unable: Unable to store the recipe. Either the %s has no space for any more recipes, or the recipe doesn't correspond with its profession.
com.minecolonies.coremod.recruit.message: %s has decided to stay in your colony as a citizen!
%s has decided to stay in your colony as a citizen! They quickly switched out of their travellers gear into some new clothes to fit in!
com.minecolonies.coremod.recruit.runaway: %s took your resources and just ran off, what a thug. D'oh!
com.minecolonies.coremod.request.toolow: I can't mine the %s at %d %d %d. You need to upgrade the building so I can use a tool with a higher mining level (or mine the block yourself).
com.minecolonies.coremod.research.alread: Research already started, please refresh the user interface
com.minecolonies.coremod.research.availa: Your colonists have found the precursors to '%s' research.
com.minecolonies.coremod.research.haveto: Build a University and research this hut to unlock it!
com.minecolonies.coremod.research.item2: at the University to be built.
Only one max-level research can be unlocked per branch.
com.minecolonies.coremod.research.requir: Requires any one %s(s) at least %d levels!
com.minecolonies.coremod.research.undo: Researchers have torn up their notes about '%s'.
com.minecolonies.coremod.research.undo.h: You can't reset a research with completed offshoots.
com.minecolonies.coremod.research.undo.p: A canceled research will lose all progress and will NOT refund items.
com.minecolonies.coremod.research.undo.r: Undoing this research will NOT refund items.
com.minecolonies.coremod.research.unlock: Upgrading to level %s requires you to complete a research at the University!
Please register a Builder's Hut first by sneak + right-clicking one!
Something went wrong opening the resource scroll, please try again!
com.minecolonies.coremod.school.nocarpet: I can't study because there is no place to sit in my School. Not that I care much, but my parents say the School has to be repaired so I can learn!
com.minecolonies.coremod.sifter.nomesh: Please make sure I have at least a string mesh to sift with! You can either manually stock different meshes in my hut or setup a minimum stock to automate it.
com.minecolonies.coremod.sifter.toomuch: Set to the current daily max of %d.
com.minecolonies.coremod.supplyneed: Start off MineColonies by crafting a Supply Camp or Ship and placing it by right clicking the item on the ground!
com.minecolonies.coremod.tooclose: Too close to world spawn, needs to be at least %d blocks away!
com.minecolonies.coremod.toofar: Too far away from the world spawn, needs to be max %d blocks away!

Your researchers made a breakthrough! They now understand '%s'.

entity.deliveryman.forcepickup: will come along and do a pickup shortly!
entity.deliveryman.forcepickupfailed: Unable to comply, pickup already in progress!
entity.farmer.nofreefields: Place more fields to get me working.
entity.farmer.noseedset: Please define the seed you want me to grow by placing it in the scarecrow!
entity.fisherman.messagewatertoofar: My hut seems to be too far away from water, and I can't find any water to fish in! It should be an area of at least 7x7 blocks, and the same height as my hut.
entity.miner.invalidmineshaft: I can't work at the mine because the mineshaft is missing the proper indication.
entity.miner.messagerequiresbetterhut: Please upgrade my hut to dig deeper!
entity.researcher.moreknowledge: During your absence, your researchers used the time to do some extra work. This will speed up their current research a bit!
entity.worker.inventoryfullchestfull: Please make space in my chests/racks. I am not able to dump my inventory.
event.minecolonies.raidmessage1: Mysterious warriors have been spotted %s of %s!
event.minecolonies.raidmessage2: Citizens report rumors of raiders %s of %s!
event.minecolonies.raidmessage3: Buckle up cowboy! There's some darn raiders comin' from the %s tonight for %s!
event.minecolonies.raidmessage4: A huge horde of raiders is comin' from %s toward %s, and they're not here to play!
event.minecolonies.raidmessage_p1: Mysterious sailors have been spotted to the %s of %s! They sailed in on a small sloop, you should consider destroying it.
event.minecolonies.raidmessage_p2: Citizens report rumors of pirates closing in %s of %s! They brought a ship, better destroy it.
event.minecolonies.raidmessage_p3: Arr Comrade! There's some darn pirates from the %s comin' for %s tonight! They sailed 'ere and will continue attacking until we destroy their caravel.
event.minecolonies.raidmessage_p4: A huge horde of pirates are sailin' %s of %s and they're not here to play! Their rigorous waves will hit us unless we destroy their galleon!
item.buildtool.missing: Missing build tool in player inventory!
item.minecolonies.banner_rally_guards.ac: You have rallied your army. %d guards are answering your call!
You have rallied your army...of none. Good luck!
item.minecolonies.banner_rally_guards.de: You have dismissed your army. Your guards will return to regular duty.
item.minecolonies.banner_rally_guards.ou: Your guards will not rally so far away, they are sworn to protect their families! The disappointed guards are going home now.
item.minecolonies.scepterbeekeeper.maxhi: You have reached the maximum number of hives. Upgrade the Apiary to increase the max number.
item.minecolonies.scepterlumberjack.rest: Forester restricted area set (x: %d to %d, z: %d to %d, area: %d blocks). The max size is %d blocks.
An area of %d blocks is too large. The maximum restricted area for the Forester is %d blocks.
item.minecolonies.scepterlumberjack.used: Second position set. Click the same position to finish.
First position set. Click the same position to finish.
item.minecolonies.scroll.colony.none: None, set one with sneak + right-click
item.supplycampdeployer.invalid: Requires a flat ground at least 16*17 blocks without grass, flowers, or holes!
item.supplycampdeployer.invalid.air_bloc: Placing a Supply Camp or Ship requires air above the ground/sea level. These blocks must be air: %s.
item.supplycampdeployer.invalid.inside_e: You cannot place your Supply Camp or Ship near an existing colony.
item.supplycampdeployer.invalid.lava_blo: Placing a Supply Ship in the Nether requires lava under the ship. These blocks must be lava: %s.
item.supplycampdeployer.invalid.solid_bl: Placing a Supply Camp requires flat, solid ground. These blocks must be solid: %s.
item.supplycampdeployer.invalid.water_bl: Placing a Supply Ship requires water under the ship. These blocks must be water: %s.
item.supplychestdeployer.invalid: You must place it in a fitting ocean or river.
item.supplychestdeployer.missing: Are you trying to trick me by picking up that Supply Ship (or Camp) again?
minecolonies.scroll.failed1: The unstable magic of the scroll backfired!
minecolonies.scroll.failed3: This scroll needs to go back to the drawing board!
minecolonies.scroll.failed4: This scroll doesn't seem to be made by the best magician out there!
minecolonies.scroll.failed6: Looks like there's a typo in one of the ancient glyphs!
minecolonies.scroll.failed7: Did my creator copy the wrong rune again?
minecolonies.scroll.failed8: Wasn't this supposed to do something?
minecolonies.scroll.needcolony: Please register this scroll to a colony first by shift-right-clicking it on a colony building.
minecolonies.scroll.noguardbuilding: Please register this scroll to a guard or barracks tower first by shift-right-clicking it on the hut block.
minecolonies.scroll.nopermission: You do not have the required permissions for this colony.
minecolonies.scroll.wrongdim: This scroll can only be used in the same dimension as the colony.
tile.blockhut.messagenopermission: You don't have permission to open huts in %s.
tile.blockhut.messagenopermissionplace: You don't have permission to place huts in %s.
tile.blockhut.messagenotownhall: You need to place a Town Hall first!
tile.blockhut.messagetoofarfromtownhall: You cannot place a building outside of your colony! Expand your colony by upgrading the Town Hall and/or building and upgrading guard towers and barracks.
tile.blockhut.tavern.limit: The amount of taverns is limited to 1 per colony. You cannot place any more in this colony.
tile.blockhut.warehouse.limit: The amount of warehouses is limited to 1 per colony. You cannot place any more in this colony without adjusting the config.
tile.blockhuttownhall.abandonaddofficer: If you want to add yourself as an officer to the abandoned colony (to retain control), click:
tile.blockhuttownhall.messageplacedalrea: You are too close to your existing Town Hall to place another.
You have placed a Town Hall already. If you want to delete your colony to start a new one, click:
You have placed a Town Hall already. If you want to delete your colony to start a new one, click [DELETE]. If you want to start a new colony but not delete your old one, click [ABANDON].
tile.minecolonies.blockhutflorist.name: Flower Shop
